content: What 1991 film directed by Jonathan Demme features Jodie Foster as an FBI agent seeking the help of a cannibalistic serial killer to catch another murderer?

The 1991 film you're referring to is "The Silence of the Lambs," directed by Jonathan Demme. In this critically acclaimed movie, Jodie Foster plays the role of FBI trainee Clarice Starling, who seeks the help of the imprisoned Dr. Hannibal Lecter, a brilliant yet dangerous cannibalistic serial killer portrayed by Anthony Hopkins, to profile and catch another notorious serial killer known as "Buffalo Bill," played by Ted Levine. The film is renowned for its intense performances, intricate plot, and exploration of dark psychological themes.
